course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Epigenetics and Chromosome Biology
course.description: Chromosome biology and epigenetics is an important field highly relevant to human health. This course will cover recent advances in the fields of epigenetics and chromosome biology.

reviews.author: yoshi

reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is good at teaching, however he can be a little spacey at times. He may get lost and can be a little confusing, but is always open to questions and will repeat something if you don't understand. He is very kind, however, he can be a little boring at times. I found his teaching quite enjoyable. Unfortunately, this class was held virtually, so there was not a lot of interaction between the professor and the students.

He goes over a lot of research papers while he is teaching, so make sure to pay attention to the diagrams and explanations he spends most of his time on.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course is absolute grading, which is great.

A range - 85+ (don't know the rest sorry)

both exams were open-book, open internet, so he made the questions slightly harder.
The midterm exam was significantly easier than the final, probably because there were fewer application questions and more memorizing questions. The final had more application questions, which is why I probably didn't do so well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Throughout the semester, there are various things we need to do.

Attendance 12%
Midterm 26%
Final 27%

Group Project (read a paper and answer questions) 10%
basically, on the day, he would give a research paper for us to read and divide us into random groups. then he would release a document containing questions that we would have to answer based on the research paper. he would then mark us based on marks given by our peers in terms of contribution to the answer.

Paper Presentation 25%
the paper presentation has a lot of weight so make sure to choose smart groupmates (2 people in a group)
we have to read the paper and present the results to the class.
He gave us interesting research papers and topics to read over and his questions were quite intellectually challenging.

reviews.comment_teaching:
The epigenetic concepts introduced are rather basic and therefore need little explanation if you have prior experience or understanding.
Explanations by professor are generally clear but the field is rather new so questions asked may be met with an answer of "I don't really know".
Professor's English is good enough if you have rich experience with different accents, generally the course material can be summarized clearly by text alone and rarely need extra explanation.
